Who wouldn't want to watch a stylish, sunglasses-sportin', saxophon-playin' cop fight crime in the sun-kissed streets of Miami? It was a game-changer, folks, and it put me on the map.

After "Miami Vice" ended, I went on to star in other TV shows and films, like "Nash Bridges" and "Tin Cup." I also did some music, releasing an album called "Heartbeat" in 1986. I sang, I danced, I rocked, and I rolled. Who knew I had a hidden talent?

Nowadays, I'm still actin', still makin' movies, still playin' music (just not as much as I used to, gotta keep the old vocal cords in shape). And I'm still lovin' life, still enjoying the ride, still wearin' my shades, and still playin' the saxophone. That's the story of me, Don Johnson, folks.
